title_sort: talcott williams to walt whitman, 15 april 1886
title: Talcott Williams to Walt Whitman, 15 April 1886
text: Ye Painte Shoppe,1833 SPRUCE STREETPHILADELPHIA.April 15. 1886My dear Mr. Whitman It is so late that I must deny myself the pleasure of coming over tomorrow and placing the proceeds in your hands. Instead I hand you these checks, as follows S Weir Mitchell100H H. Furness50J B Lippincott Co.25175 and my own check for one hundred & twenty-nine, (129) dollars, in all $304. Key sum is made up as follows The Asherah, a little society made up of Chai Leland Harrison, Lincoln Eyre, Wilson Eyre, Thos.Thomas Wharton, Carl Edelheim T.W.45.R. W. Gilder 25D. McKay10C. B. Bryant10Mrs Talcott Williams5Miss Horrie Royce5Seats sold19129. I shall be over in a day or two. It would give me, personally, very great pleasure, if it struck you favorably to send Dr. Weir Mitchell an inscribed volume of your poems and a note to the J B Lippincott Co. But the last is scarcely needed.Yours lovinglyTalcott WilliamsT. Wms Talcott Williams to Walt Whitman, 15 April 1886
